page.title: 14SANDWELL & DUDLEY STATION
page.content: This railway station was first built in 1860 as Oldbury station. It linked Oldbury to Birmingham and Wolverhampton. The old station was demolished in 1984 and replaced by a new one, re-named Sandwell and Dudley. Nowadays the station has three trains per hour which stop. A large proportion of the passengers who use the station are commuters who travel into Birmingham. The station handles up to 500 passengers each day, except at week-ends which are quieter. The station does not have freight sidings and therefore only handles parcel freight.
